predicate.note: Frames file for 'send' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'give'

example.name: ditransitive
example.text: They have begun *trace* sending letters explain the program to about five million card holders.

example.name: double object
example.text: He sent merchants around the country a form asking them to check one of three answers.
example.arg: a form asking them to check one of three answers.

roleset.name: cause to action

role.descr: project, impelled action, attribute of arg1

example.name: attribute
example.text: Lightning-fast trades of huge baskets of stocks and futures can send stock prices reeling in minutes.
example.arg: Lightning-fast trades of huge baskets of stocks and futures

example.name: NP project
example.text: Mary sent John on a wild goose chase.

roleset.note: "Send off on a wild goose chase", etc, can probably be regarded as a complex preposition ("off on") rather than a phrasal verb, since the "off" cannot occur elsewhere in the sentence ("*Mary sent John on a wild good chase off.").

example.name: stupid stock reports
example.text: News of the restructuring plan sent Sea Containers' shares up $1 to $62 in New York Stock Exchange composite trading.
example.arg: in New York Stock Exchange composite trading

example.name: not pizza
example.text: Mr. Jacobson, his gray hair flying, didn't wear out his red-white-and-blue sneakers, but he sweat so much he considered *trace* sending out for a new shirt.
